title: Possible reasons for failure to connect with other Bluetooth devices
answer:
The phone is able to support A2DP, AVRCP, HSP, OPP, HFP, PBAP, HID and other profiles; if it is confirmed that the connecting device also supports these profiles but still cannot be connected, please refer to the following situations: 

1Unable to search for other phones 

 Solution: The Bluetooth of other phones is turned on, and is ready to be searched. 

2Unable to search for a Bluetooth headset 

 Solution: Make sure the headset is ready to be searched for. For related settings, please refer to the instruction manual of the headset. 

3Unable to be connected with other phones when sending files 

 Solution: Make sure that the other phones support receiving files, or support receiving that type of file.
